title: Divinity Puffs
subject: Dessert; Meringue
ingredients: 2 egg white, 2 1/2 cups sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup light corn syrup, 3/4 cup chopped nut, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
directions: Beat egg white until stiff. Combine sugar, water and syrup. Cook until mixture reaches 234 degrees on candy thermometer. Pour half over beaten egg whites, beating constantly while pouring. Cook remaining syrup mixture to 260 degrees. Pour over the egg white mixture, beating constantly. Add nut, if desired. Add vanilla. Beat until mixture hold shape when dropped from spoon. Swirl from teaspoon onto wax paper.

title: Chocolate Cake
subject: Dessert; Cake
author: Blanche
ingredients: 1 egg, 1 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon butter, 2-3 tablespoon cocoa, 1 cup sour milk, 1 teaspoon (baking) soda, 1 1/2 cup flour, vanilla
directions: Cream egg and sugar. Melt butter cocoa together. Add to first mixture. Add soda to milk and stir in. Then add the flour and vanilla.

title: Devil's Food
subject: Dessert; Cake
author: Yhae, Anna
ingredients: 1 1/3 cup sugar, 1 cup thick cream, 2 eggs, pinch salt, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/2 cup buttermillk, 1/2 cup cocoa, 1 teaspoon (baking) soda, 1 teaspoon (baking) b powder, 2 1/2 cup flour
directions: Beat sugar and eggs hard, add cream and beat. Add buttermilk and cocoa, also (baking) soda, salt, baking powder and vanilla.

title: Lasagna - short cut style
subject: Main; Dinner
ingredients: 1pound ground beef, 1pound 2 1/2 can (3 1/3 cup) tomatoes, 1 8 ounces can (1 cup) tomato sauce, 2 envelopes spaghetti sauce mix, garlic salt or 2 cloves garlic minced, 8 ounces lasagna or wide noodles, 1 8oz (ounce) package shredded Mozzarella cheese, 1 cup cream style cottage cheese (small curd), 1/2 cup grated Parmesean cheese
directions: Brown meat slowly. Pour off excess fat. Add next 4 ingredients and cover. Simmer 40 min stirring occasionally. Salt to taste. Cook noodles in boiling salted water til tender. Drain, rinse in cold water. Place half the noodles in a 11 1/2 x 7 1/2 x 11 1/2 baking dish. Cover with a third of sauce, add half the Mozzarella cheese, then half the cottage cheese. Repeat layers ending with sauce. Top with Parmesean cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven 25-30 min. Let stand 15 minutes. Cut into squares.

title: Irish-Italian Spaghetti
subject: Main; Dinner
ingredients: 1 onion chopped, 2 tablespoon salad or olive oil, 1pound ground beef, 1 teaspoon, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon tabasco sauce, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, dash red pepper, 1 can tomato soup, 1 can cr (cream) of mushroom soup, 1/2 cup grated Parmensean cheese, 1 8oz (ounce) package spaghetti
directions: Cook onion in hot oil until golden. Add meat and seasonings; brown lightly. Cover. Simmer 10 minutes. Add soups, cover and simmer 45 min. Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and rinse with hot water.

title: Apple Crisp
subject: Dessert; Fruit
ingredients: 6 cups peeled, cored and sliced cooking apples, 2/3 quick-cooking rolled oats, 1/3 cup unsifted all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 cup butter or margarine
directions: Place apple slices in 2-quart (8x8) glass baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients, except butter, in med (medium) mixing bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Sprinkle evenly over apples. Microwave 12 to 14 minutes on HIGH or until apples are tender.

title: Men's Garden Club Panckakes
subject: Main; Breakfast
ingredients: 1 cup flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, 3/4 teaspoon B.P. (baking powder) (Royal Cream of Tartar), 1/2 teaspoon bake soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 cup buttermilk, 3 tablespoon melted butter, 1 egg

title: Chili
subject: Main; Soup
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup red chili beans or 2 1/2 cup kidney beans, 1 large onion chopped, 1pound ground beef, 3 tablespoon fat, 1 green pepper, 1 2 1/2 pound can (3 1/2 cup) tomatoes, 1/2 teaspoon salt, dash paprika, dash cayenne pepper, 3 whole cloves, bay leaf, 1-2 tablespoon chili powder
directions: Brown onion, green pepper, and meat in hot fat. Add tomatoes and seasonings . simmer 2 hrs, adding water if necessary. Add beans, heat thoroughly. Note: if using chili beans, soak overnight. Cook in boiling salted water until tender

title: Chocolate Filling
subject: Dessert; Filling
author: Crocker, Betty
ingredients: 1 egg yolk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoon flour, 1 cup milk, 1 sq chocolate
directions: Put egg yolk in top of double boiler, beat slightly, mix sugar, salt, and flour. Blend milk. Stir in chocolate cut in small pieces. Cook 20 minutes over hot water. Stir constantly until thick.

title: Cup Cakes
subject: Dessert; Cake
author: Novy, Mary Lou
ingredients: 1/4 cup butter, 1 cup sugar, 1 egg, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 4 tablespoon cocoa, 1/2 cup water, 1 1/2 cup flour, 1 1/2 teaspoon baking pow. (powder), 1/2 teaspoon salt. Icing: 1 1/2 tablespoon butter, 2 cup powdered sugar, 3 tablespoon cocoa, 4-5 tablespoon hot milk
directions: Cream butter, add sugar slowly and unbeaten egg. Mix thoroughly and add vanilla. Sift cocoa. Then add part of water and part of dry ingredients.

title: Devil's Foodcake
subject: Dessert; Cake
author: Crocker, Betty
ingredients: 2 squares chocolate, 1/4 cup shortening, 1/2 cup boiling water, 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup sour milk, 1 cup soft as silk cake flour or 7/8 cup other flour, 1/2 teaspoon (baking) soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 large egg
directions: Place the chocolate cut in small pieces and the shortening in a bowl. Pour boiling water over. Stir in sugar and sour milk. Sift flour, soda, and salt together and add all at once to mixture in bowl. Stir just enough to blend. Add whole egg unbeaten and beat the mixture until smooth. 2 layers, bake 25 min. 350 degrees

title: Chocolate Upside Down Cake
subject: Dessert; Cake
ingredients: 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 cup nut meats, 3 tablespoon cocoa, 2 tablespoon melted butter, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 3 tablespoon cocoa, 1 cup water
directions: Mix flour, sugar, salt and baking powder. Mix nut meats, cocoa, melted butter, and milk and then add mixture to dry ingredients. Oven top mix together sugar, brown sugar, cocoa, and water. Bake 40 minutes at 350 degrees

title: Watermelon Pickes
subject: Appetizer; Snack
author: Hicks, Pearl
ingredients: Watermelon rinds, 6 cups sugar, 3 cups vinegar, few cloves, stick cinnamon
directions: Cover rinds with water and boil 7 minutes. Let stand in water over night. Drain. In morning boil sugar, vinegar, cloves, and cinnamon 15 minutes. Put rinds in and boil until clear. Seal.

title: Peach Conserve
subject: Jam
author: Aunt Ola
ingredients: 12 peaches diced, 12 apples, 10 cups sugar, 10 ct can Marachino(?) cherries
directions: Cook until clear, about 1 hr or 1 1/2 hr. Add cherries and can

title: Rolls
subject: Side; Bread
author: Mildred
ingredients: 2 cups boiling water, 1/2 cup sugar plus 1 teaspoon, 1 tablespoon salt, 2 tablespoon shortening, 1/4 c lukewarm water, 2 eggs beated, 8 cups flour, 2 cakes yeast
directions: Dissolve sugar and melt lard in hot water, add salt. Cool until lukewarm. Soften yeast in lukewarm water and 1 teaspoon sugar. Stir into 1st mixture. Add beaten eggs and 4 cups flour and beat thoroughly. Stir in 4 more cups flour and mix. Brush top of dough with melted butter and put in tight container and set in refrigerator until ready to use or let rise and shape and let rise again. Bake 15 or 20 minutes in 425 degree oven.

title: Zuchinni Suzanna
subject: Side; Vegetable
author: Mrs. Briggs
ingredients: 1 package herb dressing, 1 stick margarine, 6 cups cubed zuchinni, 1/2 cup onion, 1 can cr (cream) of chicken soup, 1 cup sour cream, 1 cup shredded carrot
directions: Mix dressing and margarine. Put 1/2 mixture on bottom and 1/2 on top. Mix zuchinnis and onions and cook 5 min and drain. Mix soup, sour cream, and carrots. Bake 20-30 min at 350 degrees.

title: Apple Cake
subject: Dessert; Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup margarine, 1 cup sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup buttermilk, 2 1/2 cup flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 1/4 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon (baking) soda, 2 teaspoon cumin, 2 cup apples (diced), Topping: 1/2 cup nuts, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
directions: 9x13 - sprinkle topping mixture on top. 300 degrees the 15 min. Serve warm with ice cream.

title: Cinnamon Nut Bread
subject: Side; Bread
ingredients: 1/4 cup butter, 1 1/2 cups light brown sugar, packed, 2 eggs, 2 1/2 cups sifted flour, 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1 1/2 tsp (baking) soda, 3/4 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 1/2 cups sour cream, 1 1/2 fresh, chopped nuts
directions: Cream butter, gradually add sugar. Beat until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Sift together flour, cinnamon, soda, baking powder, and salt. Add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream, beginning and ending with dry ingredients. Stir in nuts. Bake in greased 8x4 inch pan at 350 degrees 45-50 minutes. Let cool in pan for a few minutse and turn out onto rack

title: BBQ Ribs
subject: Main; Dinner
ingredients: 3-4pound ribs, 1 lemon, 1 large onion, 1 cup catsup (ketchup), 1/3 cup worcestershire, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp salt, 2 dash tabasco, 2 cup water
directions: Place ribs in pan. Place slices of lemon and onion on ribs. Roast 450 degrees 30 min. Combine remaining ingred., bring to boil and pour over ribs. Continue baking 350 degrees about 45 min-1hr. Baste every 15 min

title: Chicken Cassarole
subject: Main; Dinner
ingredients: 1 whole chicken cup up plus 1 whole chicken breast halved, 2 tablespoon butter melted, 1 cup cr (cream) of chicken soup, 2/3 cup dry white wine, 1/2 cup slivered almonds, 1/4 cup grated Parmesean cheese
directions: Arrange pieces of chicken in a deep casserole. Pour melted butter over it and add salt and pepper. Mix 1 cup cr (cream) of chicken soup with 1/2 cup dry white wine and pour it over the chicken. Top with almonds and parmesean cheese. Bake uncovered 1hr and 15 min or til tender at 350 degrees

title: Marinated Salmon Steak
subject: Main; Dinner
ingredients: 4 fresh 1" thick salmon steaks (2lbs), 1/4 cup cooking oil, 1/4 c dry white wine, 1 teaspoon, finely shredded lime peel, 2 tablespoons, lime juice, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1/4 teaspoon pepper
directions: Broil - unheated rack - broil 4-7" 13-15 min, turn once, brush occasionally and marinate. Thaw salmon if frozen. Place in shallow dish. combine oil, wine, lime peel, lime juice, garlic and pepper. Turn over once. Cover and marinate 6 hrs or overnight. Turn occasionally. Drain salmon, reserve marinade. Pat excess moisture from salmon with paper towels. Grill on uncovered grill directly over medium hot coals 7 min. Turn and grill 6-8 min more or until salmon flake easily when tested with fork, brushing salmon occasionally with reserved marinade.

title: Rice Bavarian Cream
subject: Dessert; Pudding
ingredients: 1 envelope Knox gelatine, 1/2 cup cold water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4-1/2 cup sugar, 1 cup cooked rice, 1 cup cream whipped, 1 teaspoon vanilla
directions: Soften gelatine in cold water. Place dish in boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add to hot cooked rice, sugar, salt, and vanilla. Beat well. When cook fold on whipped cream and vanilla. Add 1 cup of fruit cocktail - pineapple, strawberries, bananas. Can add marachino cherries

title: Marshmallow Fudge Cookies
subject: Dessert; Cookie
ingredients: 2 sqares chocolate shaved, 1 cup evaporated milk, 2 cups sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 tablespoon butter, 1 1/2 packets (24) marshmallows cut in quarters, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 cups graham cracker crumbs, 1 cup walnut meets finely chopped
directions: Combine chocolate and milk and heat over low heat until chocolate is melted. Add sugar and salt, then stir until disolved. Cook until mixture reaches soft ball stage (228 degrees Fahrenheit). Remove from heat and add butter. Cook slightly, then add marshmallows, vanilla extract, graham cracker crumbs and walnut meats. Mix well. Press into well greased shallow pans. Chill eight to twelve hours or overnight then cut into squares.

title: Spicy Pumpkin Cookies
subject: Dessert; Cookie
ingredients: 1/4 cup butter or shortening, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 beaten egg, 1/2 cup pumpkin, 1 cup Omar flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon ginger, 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg, 1/2 cup nuts or raisins
directions: Cream butter and sugar. Add egg and pumpkin, mix well. Sift flour, baking poder, salt, and spices. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Add raisins or nuts. Drop on greased cookie sheet. Bake 10 min in oven 375 degrees.

title: Butterscotch Cookies
subject: Dessert; Cookie
ingredients: 1 cup brown sugar, 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon (baking) soda, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 2 scant cups flour, 1/2 cup butter, 1/3 cups sweet milk, 1/2 cup raisins or nuts or orange slices.
directions: Bake between 325 and 350 degrees.

title: Strawberry Jam
subject: Jam
author: Aunt Ola
ingredients: 2 cups sugar , 1/2 cup water, 2 cups berries, 2 cups sugar, 2 cups berries
directions: Cook 2 cups sugar and 1/2 cup water until it spins thread. Add 2 cups berries, cook stirring all the time, 3 min. Then add 2 cups more sugar and 2 cups more berries. Cook hard 10 min. Pour into earthen crock, let stand until next day. Can and cover with paraphin

title: Fruit Sherbet
subject: Dessert; Sherbet
ingredients: Juice of 3 lemons and 1 orange, 1/2 cup of shredded pineapple, 2 1/4 cups sugar and 1 qt water, 1 egg white
directions: Boil water, sugar, and several slices of lemon and orange peel for 10 min. Cook. Add juice of lemons, orange, and pineapple, freeze. When almost frozen and beaten egg white

title: Barbeque Duck
subject: Main; Dinner
ingredients: 2 ounces soy sauce, 6 ounces oil (peanut oil), 3 cloves of garlic, 4 teaspoons paprika, 2 teaspoon thyme, 1 teaspoon marjoram, 4 teaspoon celery seed, 3 teaspoon salt, 4 drops Wright smoke sauce
directions: Mix and baste duck inside and out. Turn every 7 min and baste on each turn

title: Chili Sauce
subject: Dressing
ingredients: 12 ripe tomatoes, 4 green peppers, 2 onions, 1 cup vinegar, 4 tablespoon sugar, 2 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon pepper, 1 tablespoon allspice, 1 tablespoon cinnamon, 1/2 tablespoon ground cloves
directions: Boil well about 1 hr and seal

title: Pumpkin Pie
subject: Dessert; Pie
ingredients: 1 cup steamed and strained pumpkin, 3/4 to 1 cup light brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon ginger, 2 eggs slightly beaten, 1 cup hot milk, 1 tablespoon orange juice if desired
directions: Pie Crust: make a single crust. Bak the crust with a pan in it as well as unter it for 10 minutes in a hot over 420 degrees Fahrenheit. Just before pouring in the filling, mix the pumpkin, sugar, salt, and spices. Add the eggs and then the milk and the orange juice if used. Pour the filling into the crust and bake the pie in a slow oven, 300 degrees Fahrenheit, until filling is set (30 minutes)

title: Orange Drop Cookes
subject: Dessert; Cookie
ingredients: 1/4 cups sugar, 3/4 cup shortening (may be half margarine), 2 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon vanilla, grated rind and juice of 1 orange, 1 cup sour milk, 1 teaspoon (baking) soda, 2 teaspoon baking powder, 3 cups flour. Frosting: mix 2 cups powdered sugar, 2 tablespoons butter and 2-3 tablespoons orange juice.
directions: Cream sugar with shortening. Add remaining ingredients in order given and beat well. Drop by teaspoon on greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees until edges are slightly browned 8-10 min. Frost cooled cookie. Frosting: Mix powdered sugar, butter, and orange juice.
